headline: Union Pacific’s Norfolk Southern Bid And What It Means For Valuation
summary: Union Pacific is preparing a revised application for its proposed $85 billion merger with Norfolk Southern after the Surface Transportation Board rejected the original filing. Regulators cited incomplete information and competition concerns, prompting Union Pacific to adjust its proposal. The merger could create the first coast to coast freight railroad in the U.S., with wide ranging implications for shippers, labor, and rival railroads. Union Pacific’s CEO has signaled a willingness to...

headline: Norfolk Southern rail fuels more than $7.7B in industrial development activity in 2025
summary: Norfolk Southern Corporation (NYSE: NSC) customers advanced over 60 industrial development projects in 2025, representing $7.7 billion in industry investment for new or expanded rail–served facilities along Norfolk Southern and short line partner routes. This economic activity across states and industries was made possible by the reach of Norfolk Southern's strategic network footprint.

headline: Norfolk Southern’s East Edge Corridor Puts Intermodal Growth And Valuation In Focus
summary: Norfolk Southern (NYSE:NSC) has opened its new East Edge double-stack corridor linking Chicago to New England. The corridor is designed to increase intermodal capacity and address freight bottlenecks in the Northeast. This project is described by the company as its largest operational enhancement in decades. Norfolk Southern, trading at $291.24, is putting fresh attention on its core rail network with the launch of East Edge. The company is already an established player in Eastern U.S...
